meanings.definition: The quality or state of being easily distracted.
meanings.sent1: Her distractibilities often led her to forget important tasks.
meanings.sent2: Children with high distractibilities may struggle to concentrate in class.
meanings.sent3: His distractibilities made him accidentally put salt instead of sugar in his coffee.
meanings.sent4: The distractibilities of the puppy were comparable to those of a curious toddler.
meanings.sent5: The distractibilities of the kitten were as noticeable as its playful nature.

meanings.definition: The tendency to lose focus or attention easily.
meanings.sent1: The distractibilities of the students increased during the exciting science experiment.
meanings.sent2: His distractibilities often caused him to miss important details in conversations.
meanings.sent3: The distractibilities of the squirrel led it to chase after shiny objects.
meanings.sent4: Her distractibilities were like a magnet pulling her away from her work.
meanings.sent5: The distractibilities of the baby were evident as it kept turning its head to every sound.
